metadata.title: CVE-2020-1547 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when the Windows BackupEngine improperly handles memory. To exploit this vulnerability, anattacker would first have to gain execution on the victim system. Anattacker could then run a specially crafted application to elevateprivileges. The security update addresses the vulnerability by correctinghow the Windows Backup Engine handles memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1547` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.27-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.27-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.27-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.27-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.27-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.27-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.27-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.27-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.27-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.27-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.27-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mariadb-10.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
